lines: With Herclaus leading the way, we defeated the thieves.

lines.Volesus: "Phew― Even though we weren't in any danger, that was still pretty scary..."

lines.Herclaus: "With me here, everything will be fine."
"However... while we were fighting, the thieves were shouting about their other horses."
"There may be further forces. I'm scouting ahead."

lines.Mukaki: "Hmph— If General Herclaus has to go and investigate personally, things really have gone downhill."
"...What? No! I'm the ruler of chaos, not some subservient lackey. You take care of this."

lines.Makari-Hari: "I won't be going either. I'm a divine being, after all."

lines.Herclaus: "Wait... I don't intend to bring either of you along."

lines.Vitus: "We should leave this to you then..."

lines.Herclaus: "Soon they will realise that their other members have yet to return."
"I doubt it. Every route will have been secured."
"The bandits must have known any refugees would travel this way."

lines.Volesus: "So, how do you feel about taking them out?"

lines.Herclaus: "They have power in numbers, and I'm afraid my power alone would not be enough to keep all these people safe."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Right. A task like this should be simple for Krokos."

lines.Mukaki: "I cannot fathom why he became the "Great Savant" of all things..."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Simple, it's because he's loyal to me, of course."

lines.Mukaki: "Hmph— I highly doubt that. Now, hurry up and summon him."

lines.Volesus: "Alright, I want to do it this time!"

lines: (Determined, Volesus follows the instructions and draws a magic circle on the ground.)
(He pulls Krokos' artefact from his rucksack— a crystal dagger. Carefully, Volesus places the glittering blade within the circle.)
(He recites the ancestral incantation. A striking white light appears, and a figure adorned in gold appears before the group.)

lines.Krokos: "It is I—Krokos—and I hear your call."
"Are you the one who summoned me?"

lines.Volesus: "Great Savant Krokos! It's my honour to meet you!"
"I heard that you established the standards for magic rituals. Is that true?"

lines.Krokos: "Well, you're eager— I did research ritual practises, but it's be difficult to say I created anything of great worth."

lines.Vitus: "Sorry to interrupt your academic discourse, but we have a bunch of bandits to deal with."

lines.Krokos: "Bandits? And hello Herclaus, it's nice to see you again."

lines.Herclaus: "We can catch up later, we have a task to do."
"We are protecting this group of refugees, but a bandit camp stands in our way."
"A lesser me would charge forth, but I cannot save lvies against an army alone."

lines.Mukaki: ""Hey— Krokos, use your best death curse and take them out in one fell swoop!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "As my follower, Krokos would never resort to something so vile."

lines.Mukaki: "Really? Who are you to tell him he can't follow his expertise."
"Krokos! What do you have to say for yourself?"
"You didn't join that controlling fool of your own will, did you?"

lines.Krokos: "I will have to respectfully decline commenting."

lines.Mukaki: "Oh, come on! This doesn't sound like you at all!"
"The Krokos I know would just tell me not to fucking ask!"

lines.Krokos: "I do not remember speaking so rudely before..."

lines.Vitus: "So— If we are not going with death curses, what is your plan?"

lines.Krokos: "...I will prepare a blessing, a boost to your courage and tenacity to ensure your success in the altercation with the bandits."

lines.Vitus: "So— If we are not going with death curses, what is your plan?"

lines.Krokos: "...I will prepare a blessing, a boost to your courage and tenacity to ensure your success in the altercation with the bandits."

lines.Vitus: "So we're fighting them? Doesn't that put us all at risk?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "It does, but it's for the greater good."
"Death curses should not exist in the first place..."
"Now tell me, have you read about any such spells in that library of yours?"

lines.Vitus: "Vaguely mentioned, but the spells are lost to the march of history..."

lines.Mukaki: "You would rather put us at risk, than hurt some criminals?!"

lines: >Mukaki - Wipe them out with a death curse.

lines.Volesus: "Huh— I'll be honest, I think we should have Krokos use a death curse."

lines.Vitus: "How about we decide by convincing the other refugees?"

lines: (Vitus convinces the other refugees to continue forth with Krokos' blessing.)

lines.Vitus: "So a death curse is out of the question."

lines.Volesus: "I won't argue further. At the very least, I hope to see a master at work."

lines.Krokos: "I will begin casting my blessing right away."

lines.Volesus: "Huh— I'll be honest, I think death curses are gone for a reason."
"Krokos is a great mage, we should take his blessing."

lines.Vitus: "How about we decide by convincing the other refugees?"

lines: (Vitus convinces the other refugees to have Krokos use magic to take out the bandits.)

lines.Vitus: "Let's start the death curse, then. We're counting on you, Krokos."

lines.Volesus: "I won't argue further. At the very least, I hope to see a master at work."

lines.Krokos: "I will make the necessary preparations right away."
"And please, for your safety, do not approach me during the ritual."
